label: Folder 04: Whitelaw Letter 3
description: Letter from Robert N.S. Whitelaw to Julian Mitchell, Jr. regarding his (and Hasell E. Rivers's) appointment to the city planning and zoning commission to work with the CSC on the off-street parking project (Nov. 7, 1944).

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: November 7, 1944  Mr. Juian Mitchell, Jr.  51 Broad street  Charleston 3. South Carolina  Dear Juian:  Mr. Ed Perry has informed us that  you and Mr. Barkley and Mr. Rivers have been  appointed by the city planning and zoning commission to work with the Civic Services Committee in developing its plan for off-street  parking. Be are very much peased that you  will work with us and will send you notices of  a meetings.  I am encosing a pamphet pubished  last season which outines some of the aims  and objectives of our committee and the November Issue of our magazine In which pease  see the report of the Civic Services Committee  beginning on page five.  Sincerely yours.  Robert K. s. Whitelaw  Director  Civic Services Committee  RNSW:jbw  Same letter sent to:  Mr. Matthew B. Barkey, Jr., 160 Meeting Street  Mr. Hase E. Rivers, 24 Broad Street
